entry.title: Discover scalable innovation at SAP TechEd
entry.content:
Do you pursue scalable innovation while embracing the uniqueness of customer demands?

With SAP Build and SAP BTP, you can focus on your core application domain while leveraging enterprise-grade SaaS capabilities such as multi-tenancy, streamlined customer onboarding, seamless SAP Cloud ERP integration, and built-in extensibility.üöÄ

At SAP TechEd in Berlin we will guide you through a multi-tenancy experience:

  1. Discover how multi-tenancy works with shared SAP BTP resources.

  2. Onboard a new customer on a multitenant solution.

  3. Develop and deploy a customer-specific extension.

  4. Customize the application UI to reflect your customer's unique preferences.

Interested in the architectural details? Want to dive into the code? Witness a multitenant extension operating live?
‚ñ∂Ô∏èVisit our SAP TechEd Demo Station: DT916 | Discover extensibility options for cloud ERP

Join the SAP TechEd Hands-on Workshop on Day 3:
‚ñ∂Ô∏èSession: DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

  • ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, KY (November 4-6) focuses on practical skills for North American practitioners
  • Mastering SAP in Sydney, Australia (November 12-14) brings together Asia-Pacific technical experts for intensive learning and networking
  • SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, India (November 25-26) offers hands-on workshops and certification boot camps designed for the thriving Indian developer community
  • DSAG TechXchange 2026 in Hamburg, Germany (March 19) provides specialized DevOps-focused sessions for European technical professionals

 

Must-Attend Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025

Don't miss these carefully curated sessions that will give you the deepest insights into SAP's technology roadmap and hands-on skills you can immediately apply. Here are my top recommendations for SAP TechEd Berlin, Virtual, and ASUG Tech Connect, organized by city and focus area:

SAP TechEd Berlin & Virtual

üèóÔ∏è Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • ST126 | Understanding our strategy for SAP BTP: The big picture: Get the executive overview of SAP's unified platform strategy directly from the Head of BTP Product Management. This is essential for understanding how all SAP technologies connect. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • XP100 | Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Learn practical implementation approaches using SAP's Architecture Center and Discovery Center resources. Perfect for planning your BTP adoption strategy. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

ü§ñ AI & AI Agents

  • AD202 | Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents: Build custom AI agents from scratch in Joule Studio and integrate them with SAP Build Process Automation. Features real customer use cases from Uniper Energy
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AD819 | What's new for process automation, Joule skills, and agents in SAP Build: Learn how enterprise automation is evolving from structured workflows to intelligent, autonomous experiences, and how Joule Studio supports custom skill and agent creation for AI-driven process transformation.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AI102 | Boosting business efficiency with AI innovations in document processing: Discover how SAP Document AI automates structured and unstructured document processing with cutting-edge AI technologies. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AI105 | Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio: You can learn how to create, deploy, and manage agents tailored to your business needs‚Äîfeaturing live demos and a walkthrough of key capabilities for developers and IT teams.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible: Understand AI agent governance and security through SAP Integration Suite's API Management capabilities.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

üíª Application Development & Automation

  • AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions: Get exclusive previews of upcoming SAP Build enhancements including Joule copilot integration and improved developer productivity tools. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • AD104 | Boost your ABAP development with SAP Joule for Developers: Learn how AI is transforming ABAP development with SAP Joule, from code acceleration to custom AI scenario development.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation: Get hands-on experience combining SAP Integration Suite with SAP Build and SAP Signavio solutions. Learn to create automation-based integrations powered by AI capabilities and prebuilt content to drive process innovation.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN

 üîó Integration

  • IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

üîí Security & Compliance

  • XP802 | Road map for security and compliance services in SAP BTP: Stay ahead of security requirements with upcoming BTP security features, identity management, and compliance enhancements. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • ST104 | Unlocking value with the multi-cloud foundation for SAP BTP: Learn about platform administration, custom application lifecycle management, and SAP BTP‚Äôs business focus for enterprise-grade, hybrid landscapes.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN

  • XP207 | Mastering zero trust: SAP Customer Identity and Access Management: Use policies and tools in SAP Customer Identity and Access Management to protect customers‚Äô accounts and access while delivering zero trust‚Äîready applications.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN

 

ASUG Tech Connect - Louisville, KY

üèóÔ∏è Platform Strategy & Architecture

  • Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform: Get a complete overview of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to explore the full potential of the platform. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Accelerate adoption of SAP Business Technology Platform with confidence: Gain hands-on experience in accelerating your adoption of SAP BTP with SAP Discovery Center, a single point of entry for BTP and Business AI knowledge assets. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

ü§ñAI & AI Agents

  • AI-Powered Document Automation: Accelerate SAP Processes with Confidence: We will share real-world examples of global companies using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to streamline document processing, improve data accuracy, and achieve measurable results in a matter of weeks. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Build Your Own AI Solution with the Generative AI Hub: Get hands-on experience building a custom AI solution with the generative AI hub capability in AI Foundation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Hands-on Lab: Get Hands-on Experience to Extend Joule and Build AI Agents: Get hands-on experience with Joule Studio to extend Joule technology with custom skills and build AI agents. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Extend Joule with Custom Skills and Custom Agents for SAP Cloud ERP: Get maximum value from the Joule copilot in SAP Cloud ERP by extending it with custom-built skills and intelligent agents that can plan, act, and execute tasks. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW       

  • Discovery Workshop: Start Your AI Agent Journey by Exploring AI Agent Use Cases: Explore how AI Agent capabilities can address your specific business challenges and learn the next steps for designing and building an AI Agent using the SAP Agent Builder. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW
  • Hands-on Lab: Get hands-on with Joule, Boost your SAP Build Development with AI: Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW          

 üíª Application Development & Automation

  • SAP Build: Latest Innovations and Road Map: Explore the strategic road map for the SAP Build portfolio and see how recent and upcoming innovations in low-code and pro-code tools are transforming application development, process automation, and business site design. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Introduction to Application Development and Automation: Learn how the key capabilities, recent innovations, and road map for SAP‚Äôs application development and automation solutions enable you to build, extend, and automate apps quickly. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîó Integration

  • Introduction to Integration: Harness AI to Future-Proof Your Integration Investment: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • ASUG Community Conversations- SAP Integration in SAP Business Technology Platform: Connect with SAP experts and the ASUG Community as they share their experiences, solutions, and strategies. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Innovations, Investments, and Future Road Map for SAP Integration Suite: Explore recent innovations across API management, event-driven architecture, B2B integration, hybrid deployment models, and AI-driven automation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîí Security & Compliance

  • Explore Security Services with SAP BTP: Explore the extensive capabilities of SAP BTP in security, identity, and access management. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 

Register. Attend. Reap Results.

The sessions above represent hours of curated content distilled into the most impactful learning opportunities to deliver technical knowledge at SAP TechEd 2025. You'll get architecture frameworks, implementation strategies, and direct access to the platform's subject matter experts. Whether you're migrating integrations, deploying AI agents, or hardening security, these sessions answer your actual questions. And of course, you can't miss the keynotes at SAP TechEd to explore how SAP's newest technologies and capabilities will bring in results:

SAP TechEd - Berlin & Virtual

  • KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next: Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt to these changing roles. 
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • KEY101 | Draft day for developers: Turning new technology into real-world wins: Explore how you can use SAP‚Äôs newest AI capabilities, generative agents, and enhanced tooling to build faster and smarter with less friction and more impact.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • KEY103 | SAP TechEd closing: Wrap up SAP TechEd with highlights, key takeaways, and a look at what‚Äôs ahead. From breakthrough demos to developer wins, celebrate what you‚Äôve learned, where you‚Äôve connected, and how you can keep the momentum going long after SAP TechEd is over.
    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

 ASUG Tech Connect - Louisville, KY

  • Shaping What‚Äôs Next: Insights from SAP, Databricks, and Customers: Join ASUG CEO Geoff Scott as he sits down with leaders from SAP, Databricks, and SAP customers to unpack the big themes driving transformation, from cloud and AI to business change and innovation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • In the Spotlight: Partner-Customer Stories That Move SAP Forward: You‚Äôll hear directly from three SAP partners and their customers as they take the stage together to share how they tackled tough challenges, achieved measurable outcomes, and transformed their business through SAP solutions. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 

Register now, add these sessions to your agenda, and come with your toughest problems.

entry.title: CAP at SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

SAP TechEd 2025 is almost there! This year, SAP TechEd is a hybrid event: from November 4 ‚Äì 6 you can either join the in-person event in Berlin or the online event SAP TechEd Virtual. Hundreds of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities are waiting for you.

If you didn‚Äôt already do it, save the date and register today: SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual!

In the session catalogs for the in-person and the virtual event, you will find a wide range of topics across various tracks. If you are interested in all the latest news around the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), let me guide you through my recommendations.

Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next

Some experts argue there‚Äôs a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let‚Äôs get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles.

This session is also available virtually: KEY100v.

Strategy Talk

ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Explore the most recent innovations in SAP Build solutions that help developers to create extensions, applications, and automations. Learn how enhancements in the development environment, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, and Joule copilot empower customers and partners to build extensions efficiently at scale.

This session is also available virtually: ST116v.

Roadmap Sessions

AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying Clean Core & LoB extensions‚Äã

Check out upcoming enhancements to SAP Build solutions involving SAP‚Äôs professional developer tools, the Joule copliot, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These updates boost developer productivity, support clean core, and improve extensibility for line-of-business (LoB) apps, advancing enterprise app development.

This session is also available virtually: AD820v.

Deep Dive Sessions

AD101 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build‚Äã

The SAP Business Data Cloud solution unifies SAP and third-party data, and SAP Build solutions let you discover and use data products in the service center and consume them in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Get details on sharing data from these apps and using built-in tools for service-level integration.

AD203 | Fact checking UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?‚Äã

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps in a clean core approach. Key users use drag-and-drop tools while developers add custom code with visual editors and the Joule copilot. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and ABAP RESTful application programming model help extend data models and add custom logic in SAP Build solutions.

Hands-On Workshops:

AD160 | Get Hands-On with Joule: Boost Your SAP Build Development with AI‚Äã

The SAP Joule for Developers add-on brings AI capabilities directly into SAP Build solutions to support your development process. Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter.                                                                            

AD161 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build‚Äã

Get hands-on experience with the SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Build solutions to find out how to discover and use data products in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Practice sharing data from CAP apps and using built-in tools for service integration and SAP HANA‚Äìbased data federation.

AD260 | UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?‚Äã

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps with a clean core approach. Key users and developers can add custom code with visual editors and Joule technology. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and the ABAP RESTful application programming model support extending data models and adding custom logic in the SAP Build solution.

DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP‚Äã

Experience how to provision, configure, and extend multitenant solutions based on SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) for SAP Cloud ERP. Using a reference example, you‚Äôll explore how to deliver customer-specific extensions on a scalable and resource-efficient multitenant architecture.

 

We can‚Äôt wait to see you at SAP TechEd 2025, either in Berlin or virtually!

entry.title: Influence the Next Wave of SAP BTP Innovation: Join the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025-3
entry.content:
Transforming Enterprise Innovation with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP)

SAP BTP is revolutionizing how businesses innovate. This integrated platform combines application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI, empowering enterprises to achieve new levels of efficiency and intelligence.

Now, you can be a part of this transformation.

The third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is here, offering you the opportunity to shape the future of SAP BTP. As a customer or partner, you‚Äôre invited to collaborate directly with SAP developers and product teams to influence upcoming features, tools, and innovations.

This is not just about early access; it‚Äôs a chance to steer the direction of enterprise technology.

Don‚Äôt wait - registration is open only until November 14, 2025.

Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • Attachment handling made easy with SAP Document Management service CAP Plugin
  • CAP Apps and SAP BTP Kyma Runtime Environment
  • Effortlessly manage you documents using SAP Document Management service mobile application
  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP
  • SAP Discovery Center: Long-Term User Research Initiative
  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

Let‚Äôs build the future together!

Innovation thrives through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP develop more effective and relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to impact the future of enterprise technology.

Don‚Äôt miss out - sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards,

Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. Participation beyond this point is optional and typically governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: Info/Links for TechEd Community Talk CT1293 - SAP Build Control Tower
entry.content:
This post is to provide additional reference information and links related to my community talk CT1293 - Get control of the control tower feature in SAP Build solutions. See you there.

Control Tower Layout

Here's is the current picture of the Control Tower.

I think the layout is simple and clean, though it has evolved with additional tiles over the last 2 years and I don't think it's so clear how everything is inter-related. Here is my annotated version with a few notes. 

My notes:

  • Environments, introduced relatively recently with the public environment deprecated, seems to me the central most-important tile on the page
  • Destinations and API keys are strongly connected to environments
  • The first 3 tiles are related to transport: The first defines whether the tenant is dev/qa/prod for the sake of transport, and the governance rules (next 2 tiles) in part add an extra layer of approval for transport operations. The rules also affect simply creating a project.

More information on the Control Tower: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/managing-control-tower?locale=en-US

Permissions

There are many layers of permissions within SAP Build. Here they are from highest to lowest level.

IAS

Identity Authentication Service (IAS), or perhaps now just Cloud Identity Service, is the very first level and at the most basic level lets you create new users.

I just want to point out one helpful feature are groups. I can set up a group and then assign that group role connections. When I have a new user I just add them to the group and they inherent all the role collections. 

Here are groups in IAS.

Here I assign a group to a role collection. Note that SAP BTP does not have a dropdown of groups so you have to simply type in the name of the group.

YOu can do the same with attributes, for example, assign a role collection based on job function or home country.

More information: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/landing-page?locale=en-US

Tenants

Once you have a user in IAS, you can assign that user to a tenant and NOT assign them to other tenants. You can look in the Users page to see which users have access to the current tenant.

More information: https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/sap-business-technology-platform/business-users?locale=en-US

Roles

Once a user has access to the tenant in some way, you determine what they can do on that tenant by assigning them roles, not directly, but through role collections, which are sets of roles that loosely map to a persona (e.g., admin, developer, business user, super user).

Here's more information on the specific roles/role collections related to the low-code tools of SAP Build:

  • SAP Build Apps: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-apps/service-guide/configuring-user-roles?locale=en-US&q=role
  • SAP Build Process Automation: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/authorizations?locale=en-US&q=role
  • SAP Build Work Zone: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/about-roles-and-role-assignments?locale=en-US&q=role

Design-Time Authorizations

These authorizations are done on the project level, some know as collaboration authorizations, so you can work with others on specific projects.

For information on the meaning of each role, see https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/managing-project-members?locale=en-US.

Runtime Automarizations

Runtime authorizations are the authorizations you have within environments. Environments are separate areas for deploying projects, and each environment can be set up to allow different users to do different activities (e.g., view, deploy, add users).

For information on the meaning of each role, see https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/share-environment.

Governance Rules

Governance rules let you set up a process to be executed so managers can approve or reject whether another user can create a project or transport a project.

If you enable rules for either creation or transport, you are automatically given into the lobby an out-of-the-box process and action. You must deploy the process before the rules can take effect (the action is automatically published). Before deploying, you can modify the process -- you really must since it the process automatically gives the requestor the right to approve his own project.

For more information, see https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/governance?locale=en-US&q=governance+rules.

Transport

Transport allows you to create formal processes for moving projects from one tenant to another tenant, generally from DEV > QA > PROD. The transport does not deploy projects but simply moves the design-time projects from one SAP Build installation to another. You can only transport a released version.

You will have to install Cloud Transport Manager Service, and add the Content Agent Service on every tenant to which you want to transport content. 

Once you have everything setup and execute a transport from the SAP Build lobby, the package goes to CTMS, where someone with the import role will need to approve the transport. 

For more information on setting up transport, see https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/transporting-content-in-sap-build-apps-sap-cloud-transport-management/ba-p/13737478.

For more information on how to transport and prerequisites, see https://help.sap.com/docs/build/sap-build-core/transport-project?locale=en-US&q=transport.

entry.title: How Redwood Software and SAP are shaping the next era of automation with Joule Studio
entry.content:
Introduction

Over the past year, Redwood Software has taken major steps forward in our long-standing partnership with SAP, turning the vision of conversational, agentic automation into something you can see and use today.

As Field CTO at Redwood, I‚Äôve spent many years helping SAP customers orchestrate their most critical workloads. Our shared mission with SAP has always been clear: make complex processes simpler, more reliable and, ultimately, autonomous.

Embedding automation into conversation with Joule Studio

In my previous post, I introduced how RunMyJobs by Redwood connects with SAP Joule Studio to transform automation into natural conversation. Since then, we‚Äôve built a tech preview that demonstrates a use case for how RunMyJobs‚Äô interoperability with SAP Joule makes agentic orchestration a reality you can scale for your most mission-critical processes.

One example is an autonomous, unplanned SAP system maintenance workflow. Traditionally, this requires multiple manual steps and cross-team coordination to pause background jobs, stop dependent integrations and verify dependencies. The SAP BTP team often has to schedule, stop or undeploy iFlows ad hoc, while the Basis team handles job suspension separately. Thus, it‚Äôs a fragmented process filled with stress and risk.

Today, an SAP Basis administrator can take a more goal-oriented approach. They can simply tell Joule what they need to do: 

‚ÄúSafely execute the SAP system maintenance procedure, including a pause on all dependent workflows associated with the system to avoid job failures.‚Äù

Joule triggers the complete, pre-approved workflow across RunMyJobs and the relevant SAP systems. Acting as an interactive control tower for the entire event, it executes pre-approved RunMyJobs workflows, coordinates with integrations and provides real-time progress and approval updates through natural language with either business or IT users.

For example, Joule might respond: 

‚ÄúAll background jobs are paused, and Integration Suite iFlows are offline. Do you approve the system restart now, or do you want to send an approval request to the system administrator for a restart?‚Äù 

Once the administrator confirms, the automated workflow proceeds to the next step.

üëâSee Joule in action with RunMyJobs here:

 

What we learned building Joule skills

Working with Joule Studio‚Äôs low-code design canvas confirmed how quickly governed automation can be delivered through conversational interfaces. Our approach focused on four essentials:

  1. Natural conversation design: Translating how SAP users actually phrase requests into machine-understandable prompts
  2. Action orchestration: Linking RunMyJobs APIs or pre-built SAP Accelerator Hub actions for pausing jobs, managing iFlows and performing restarts safely
  3. Context and safeguards: Supplying metadata so Joule executes only on the right systems, with test harnesses for edge cases
  4. Governed deployment: Leveraging accelerated compliance checks provided by RunMyJobs‚Äô SAP Endorsed App Premium certification to reliably execute controlled deployment across SAP environments

How RunMyJobs and Joule Studio connect

The integration between RunMyJobs and Joule Studio allows your teams to innovate safely across SAP environments and in various scenarios. The process looks like this:

  1. Publish operations in RunMyJobs, such as starting or pausing jobs.
  2. Publish actions to the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, making them available as reusable building blocks. 
  3. Secure access through SAP BTP using API keys and role-based permissions. You then govern access to these operations within the SAP BTP Cockpit. 
  4. Combine these actions in Joule Studio to build skills that connect automation with natural language requests.

This framework lets IT and business teams interact with automation directly in their workflow tools, so it‚Äôs governed, auditable and ready for expansion.

The future of automation is a conversation

We are only at the starting line of what‚Äôs possible. The combination of RunMyJobs and SAP Joule is laying the foundation for agentic automation across finance, supply chain, HR, IT and beyond. As SAP continues to advance its Business AI capabilities, Redwood will keep embedding orchestration where it matters most: within the business conversation.

Learn more about how Redwood works with SAP solutions.

entry.title: The Joule Studio Learning Series: Lead Agentic Development with Confidence
entry.content:
Organizations are adopting agentic AI to transform how work gets done. Joule Studio offers developers a low code, no code environment to design and deploy secure, scalable, and interoperable Joule agents that plan and execute workflows in a heterogenous landscape. 

To help you get started, I‚Äôve created a four-part enablement video series that walks you through everything: from understanding what Joule Studio is to building Joule agents. Whether you‚Äôre just getting started or an experienced developer, this series will help you transform business workflows with the power agentic AI and Joule Studio. By the end of this enablement series, you‚Äôll have an understanding of: 

  • Joule Studio: its marketecture and capabilities   
  • Joule agents and skills: definition, characteristics, and use cases
  • How to build, test, and deploy your own Joule agents and skills

What is Joule Studio? 

Start your learning journey with an introduction to Joule Studio, underlying components, and how it enables the creation of adaptive, intelligent agents for business workflows.

You‚Äôll learn: 

  • What Joule Studio is and what problems it solves 
  • Key capabilities and components 
  • The value Joule Studio delivers

 

 

What Are AI Agents and Joule Skills? 

Dive into the fundamentals. Understand the building blocks of Joule Studio: AI agents and Joule skills, how they work together, their characteristics, and use cases. 

You‚Äôll learn: 

  • Difference between Joule skills and AI agents 
  • How AI agents work 
  • Common use cases for both 

 

Creating a Joule Skill in Joule Studio 

In this hands-on demo, learn how to create a Joule skill within SAP Build using Joule Studio for predictable execution of rule-based, repetitive tasks. The example walks through creating an ID badge in a third-party system after performing a preliminary check in SAP.  

You‚Äôll learn: 

  • How to configure inputs and outputs for a Joule skill 
  • How to connect SAP and external systems 
  • How to configure messages to Joule 

 

Creating Joule Agents in Joule Studio 

See the agent builder capability in Joule Studio in action. This video shows how to create and configure a Joule agent end-to-end, equipping it with tools, models, and other configurations for adaptive execution in a business scenario. 

You‚Äôll learn: 

  • How to create and test Joule agent 
  • How to configure tools, models, and skills 

 

Get Started with Joule Studio 

Ready to build your first agent? Check out additional documentation and resources to get started: 

  • How to get started with Joule Studio 
  • The Complete Joule Studio Resource Hub

entry.title: Build Business-Grounded AI Agents, Faster
entry.content:
At Sapphire 2025, SAP announced Joule Studio, a capability in SAP Build that enables developers to create Joule agents and skills. Deeply grounded in business data, these agents orchestrate workflows across heterogenous landscapes to deliver accurate outcomes. Joule Studio delivers an agent runtime with built-in data protection guardrails, multi-LLM support, and context retention across tasks for scalable, secure execution.  

Today, we are announcing additional capabilities that will equip developers with a comprehensive development tool kit to build scalable agentic AI for their business. We are introducing vibe coding experience to create not only conversational but also system-triggered AI agents. Instead of building from scratch, developers can also extend ready-to-use Joule agents as per their business needs. Joule Studio will also support open standards such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol. These advances empower developers to deliver end-to-end agentic automation with greater speed, flexibility, and control. See what our customers and partners from the beta program (Q3 2025) have to say: 

‚ÄúWith Joule Studio, we could build powerful agents in three weeks. It is an intuitive, no‚Äëcode environment that enables system connectivity across SAP and non‚ÄëSAP critical environments, for a hybrid landscapes where data resides in multiple modules.‚Äù 

 - Gianluca Simeone, VP - Global SAP CTIO and Gen-AI Leader at Capgemini 

‚ÄúNestle, SAP, and IBM worked together on a supply chain Agentic AI PoC. With the agent builder capability in Joule Studio, we created this POC bringing in data from SAP and non-SAP sources to create an agent that will automate our complex Order fulfillment processes‚Äù  

- Pablo Nill, Sr Product Group Manager, Nestle  

 ‚ÄúWith Joule Studio, agentic innovation moves closer to the heart of operations. At KPMG, we‚Äôre helping to shape trusted solutions that transform business context into measurable value by building specialized AI agents for fulfillment orchestration, supply chain management, and more‚Äù. 

 - Valentino K√∂ster, Global Head of SAP360 Program & AI, KPMG AG WPG, Germany 

Fast‚ÄëTracking Ideas into Agents: Empowering Developers with AI 

To lower the barrier to AI adoption, Joule Studio provides AI assistance in the design-time experience of creating agents. Developers can use natural language to share their requirements with Joule copilot and get contextual recommendations for agent definition, tools, and other configurations, tailored to their specific needs. For example, Joule may suggest and add relevant Joule skills to custom Joule agents. This makes agent creation more accessible and accelerates time-to-value. 

Image 1: AI-assistance in Joule Studio

Cross-Ecosystem Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) 

One of the most significant updates is Joule Studio‚Äôs support for MCP, an open standard that provides a unified way to connect AI agents with external systems. This breaks down traditional application silos and enables cross-platform agent execution. In Joule Studio, you can configure connectivity to external MCP servers, allowing agents to use third-party tools and applications. For example, a support agent that you built in Joule Studio can retrieve ticket information from a third-party IT service platform exposed via MCP. This open integration empowers AI agents to act as central, intelligent orchestrators, managing complex workflows across diverse systems without the need for custom integrations.  

Image 2: Configuration of tools, MCP servers, and models for agent design

Proactive Agentic Automation with System-Triggered Agents 

Joule Studio will support the creation of system-triggered AI agents that operate autonomously with no human input. Triggers such as business events, APIs, and schedules will be supported for agents to be initiated. This elevates agents from being reactive to proactive collaborators, capable of initiating actions like inventory monitoring and initiating purchase orders for low stock items or incident response. That enables true end-to-end automation of business processes with minimal human intervention.  

Image 3: Add triggers for custom agents

Adapt Pre-Built, SAP-Delivered Agents to Your Enterprise  

In Joule Studio, developers will be able to extend ready-to-use Joule agents by adding additional tools and custom skills as pre- and post-processing steps. For example, extend an Accounts Receivable Agent, which analyzes overdue receivables and follows up with customers, by grounding it in your order handling policy for informed decision making. This allows you to tailor ready-to-use Joule agents to your unique business requirements.

Image 4: Extending ready-to-use Joule agents 

Getting Started with agent builder in Joule Studio

The agent builder will be generally available in December 2025 with support for MCP, agent as a tool, vibe coding, and document grounding part of first release. Later in 2026, we will release support for agent extensibility, system-triggered agents, A2A, and agent observability. 

If you are interested in learning more:

  • Register for the webinar for a closer look at agent builder experience: Link
  • Visit the Joule Studio webpage: Link
  • Checkout demo on building Joule agents in Joule Studio: Demo

entry.title: From Skill to Agent: Building a Legal Payment-Solicitation Letter with Joule Studio
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning on a Joule Studio experimental environment. The final version that will be released may provide a different set of capabilities.

Introduction

Finance teams spend valuable time preparing formal demand letters: finding the correct legal recipient, composing language that satisfies local legal requirements, and ensuring consistent formatting. Joule Studio (part of SAP Build) lets you automate these steps using modular Skills and orchestrating Agents ‚Äî while preserving governance and auditability.

This article walks through a complete pattern: configure secure connectivity to S/4HANA, build the Get Customer Information Skill, then compose the Credit Collection Specialis that generates language-specific legal letters ready for review and sending.

Quick definitions

Joule Skill

A focused, reusable function with defined inputs and outputs. Example: retrieve a customer‚Äôs legal name and address from S/4HANA.

Joule Agent

An intelligent orchestrator that invokes Skills, makes decisions, handles user interactions, and produces business outcomes (for example: draft a legal letter, request approval, send the letter, and log the result).

Use case: Legal payment-solicitation letter

Goal: allow a collections specialist to enter a customer number, debt amount and language ‚Äî and receive a legally formatted demand letter populated with S/4HANA legal data.

Inputs: customer_number, debt_amount, language
Outputs: Draft legal letter (text format).

We will build:

  • Skill: CustomerLegalDataFetcher ‚Äî fetches legal name & address from S/4HANA.
  • Agent: PaymentSolicitationAgent ‚Äî orchestrates retrieval and generates the letter text in the selected language.

Step 0 ‚Äî Configure secure connectivity (BTP Destination & Action Project)

Before the Skill can call S/4HANA, set up a Destination in BTP and an Action Project in SAP Build to expose the needed API in a governed way.

Create a Destination in SAP BTP Cockpit

  1. Log in to SAP BTP cockpit ‚Üí Subaccount ‚Üí Connectivity ‚Üí Destinations ‚Üí New Destination.
  2. Name: S4HANA_BP. Type: HTTP. URL: your S/4HANA API base (e.g. https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER).
  3. Proxy Type: Internet (or OnPremise if using Cloud Connector). Select Authentication (OAuth2ClientCredentials or BasicAuth) and provide credentials or client info.
  4. Optional properties: sap-client, HTML5.DynamicDestination=true, WebIDEEnabled=true,sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled=treu,sap.processautomation.enabled=true. Save and Check Connection.

Create an Action Project in SAP Build

  1. Open SAP Build, move to Actions window (selecting it on the left hand side menu) and click on the Create button. 
  2. Go to API Specification and select SAP Business Accelerator Hub.  Here you can find the Business Partner (A2X) API specification.  Select it and click on Next button.  Assign a name to the project: S4HANA_Customer_Actions Connections and provide a description. Click on Create button.
  3. Select the API calls to be added to the project. For the purpose of this implementation, you can select Retrieves customer general data and Retrieves business partner address data.  
  4. After adding them to the project, the Action editing GUI appears, providing  the ability to fine tune the inputs and the outputs of your actions.
  5. You can test the Actions selecting the name of the destination you created before. After finalizing the Actions, you need to Release and Publish the project.

Result: your Action is published and available to be called from a Joule Skill.

Step 1 ‚Äî Build the Skill: Credit Collection Letter

A. Create the Skill project

  1. From the SAP Build Lobby,  Create  ‚Üí Joule Skill ‚Üí Name: Credit Collection Letter. 
  2. Now, from the Joule Studio main page: Create  ‚Üí Joule Skill ‚Üí Name: Get Customer Information
  3.  Assign a meaningful description, such as: A skill to retrieve Customer information from a S/4HANA system, providing as input the Customer Number.
  4. Define the input parameter of the skill (CustomerNumber) and the output parameters (CustomerLegalName, streetName, houseNumber, cityName, postalCode and country).

B. Call the Action

  1. Add two Call Action step ‚Üí choose S4HANA_Customer_Actions and the customer and address lookup actions.
  2. Map inputs/outputs between Skill and Action. 
  3. In the End step, map the output of the Action calls to the skill's output parameters.

C. Test the Skill

Before testing the skill, you need to create an environment and to associate the destination to this environment:

  1. From the SAP Build Lobby,  open the Control Tower from the menu on the left hand side.
  2. Open the Environments page. You can find it in the Tenant Configuration section. 
  3. Click on the Activate Private Environment button. 
  4. Go back to the Control Tower and open the Destinations page. You can find it in the Backend Configuration section.
  5. Find the destination you defined in the BTP Cockpit, open the Actions menu on the right side and select Associate Environments.
  6. Now you can associate the destination to the private environment you activated in step #3.

Once the environment has been created, with an associated destination, from the Skill editing page you can test the skill clicking on the Test button. Select your private environment and the destination. The Joule prompting page is displayed and you can send some prompts to test the Skill. 

 

 

Step 2 ‚Äî Build the Agent: Credit Collection Specialist

A. Create the Agent

  1. From the Joule Studio main page: Create  ‚Üí Joule Agent ‚Üí Name: Credit Collection Specialist
  2. Add a description, such as: Writer of reminder letters for unpaid debts
  3. Now in the Agent Builder page, you need to fill the Expertise, the Instructions and the Additional Context text boxes. Tip #1: in the instructions, please specify that the Get Customer Information skill should be used for retrieving the customer's information. Tip #2: Provide an example of the letter you want it writes.
  4. Chose the LLM model to be used, selecting between the available ones.
  5. In the Tools section, add the Get Customer Information skill as a tool to be used.

‚ÄÉ

B. Attach Tools

  • In the Tools section, add the Get Customer Information skill as a tool to be used.

C. Test and Deploy the Agent

  1. Save the Agent and click on the Test button. Select your private environment and the destination.
  2. The Joule prompting page is displayed and you can send some prompts to test the Agent. 
  3. Once the Agent is fully debugged, you can Release and Deploy the project to one of the environments available. If necessary, you can create a new environment from the Control Tower.

Security, governance & integration notes

Use service credentials or OAuth client credentials for the Destination. Limit Destination editing to admins, and ensure Cloud Connector is configured if S/4HANA is on-premise. Maintain a clear change-control process for legal templates ‚Äî any change must trigger regression tests of the Agent.

Conclusion & call to action

By separating retrieval (Skill) from orchestration (Agent), you make the solution reusable, testable and governable. Users simply provide the customer number, amount and language ‚Äî Joule handles the rest, identifying the Agent and the Skill to be used: fetch data and generate compliant letter text that can be cut and pasted into a Word document.

And that‚Äôs all for today! Now you can continue reading other posts on the SAP Community Blogs: https://community.sap.com/t5/all-sap-community-blogs/ct-p/all-blogs
